div.p: Highly learned, dear Mr. Bullinger, now someone comes to me and tells me that someone... said at your table that the little book I sent you is Schwenckfeldian.
But believe me, the one who let the little book go out does not know how to speak of Mr. Schwenckfeld. It is another man and he is a Netherlander far away from Cologne.

I believe, when you have read it, you will find it differently, and I ask you to read it, the first and this one, and to reveal to me your findings at a convenient time; for certainly it did not originate from Mr. Caspar Schwenckfeld nor was it derived from his teachings. With this, may God protect you.
Justina, Countess of Lupfen, wrote. To the highly learned Mr. Heinrich Bullinger, etc.
